section.paragraph: API for the Calendar Sync Application

desc_content.paragraph: Enables the Calendar Sync config for a particular user and course. Will create if needed.

desc_content.paragraph: Disables the Calendar Sync config for a particular user and course. If the instance does not exist, this function will do nothing.

section.title: openedx.features.calendar_sync.ics module
section.paragraph: Generate .ics files from a user schedule

block_quote.paragraph: Generates ics-formatted bytestrings of all assignments for a given course and user.
Returns a dictionary of ics files, each one representing an assignment.
Generates an ics-formatted bytestring for the given assignment information.

Check if the User calendar sync is enabled for a particular course. Returns False if the object does not exist.

list_item.paragraph: user (User) – The user to check against
course_key (CourseKey) – The course key to check against

field_body.paragraph: (bool) True if the config exists and is enabled. Otherwise, False

section.title: openedx.features.calendar_sync.plugins module
section.paragraph: Platform plugins to support Calendar Sync toggle.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: CourseTool
The Calendar Sync toggle tool.
Returns an id to uniquely identify this tool in analytics events.
Additional data to send with a form submission
Returns the icon classes needed to represent this tool.
The Calendar Sync toggle tool is limited to user enabled through a waffle flag. Staff always has access.
Returns the title of this tool.
Returns the URL for this tool for the specified course key.

section.title: openedx.features.calendar_sync.signals module
section.paragraph: Signal handler for calendar sync models

desc_content.paragraph: Helper function to create a list contain file attachment objects for use with MIMEMultipart Returns a list of MIMEApplication objects

section.title: Module contents
section.paragraph: Calendar syncing Course dates with a User.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a unique event id based on a user and a course block key

list_item.paragraph: user (User) – The user requesting a calendar event
block_key (str) – The block key containing the date for the calendar event
date_type (str) – The type of the date (e.g. ‘due’, ‘start’, ‘end’, etc.)
hostname (str) – A hostname to namespace this id (e.g. ‘open.edx.org’)
